Transcript:
Harley: I don't know what's worse, the fact that you have been lying to gus 
from the start or the fact that you are still lying, still trying to save your 
sorry butt. It's over. Just admit what you did and get it done with.
Alexandra: I have nothing to admit, harley.
Gus: Hey, listen! Sorry, I can't let you do this anymore.
Alexandra: Gus, I'm sorry. I'm sorry.
Gus: No, I'm not talking to you. I'm talking to you.
Danny: Hey, reva.
Reva: Danny, hi.
Danny: How are you doing? Were you working late?

Reva: Um, actually, no. Josh is meeting a client and i am signing up for 
salsa lessons.
Danny: Oh, salsa lessons. Wow. Good for you. Good for you.
Reva: Actually, I got the idea from michelle.
Danny: Michelle?

Reva: Mm-hmm. She just has this whole new energy and, I don't know, newness 
around her.
Danny: Oh, yeah.
Reva: It inspired me to kind of try something new for myself.
Danny: Yeah. Well, this newness is making me feel pretty old.
Reva: I know this can't be easy for you, danny.

Danny: You know, reva, I am all for michelle exploring, whatever, finding who 
she is, whatever she wants to call it, but it's kind of difficult for me to give 
her her space, at the same time looking out for her, when I don't even know what 
she's doing from one minute to the next. (Cell phone rings) it's ridiculous. 
Excuse me.
Reva: Mm-hmm.

Danny: Yeah? Speaking. Uh-huh. Wait, wait, hold on. My wife didn't buy a 
chair from your store. She did? And a what? (Music playing)
Everything's so blurry and everyone's so fake
and everybody's empty and everything is so messed up
preoccupied without you I cannot live at all

my whole world surrounds you I stumble... (cell phone ringing) yeah, hey, 
it's danny. I need to see you. It's michelle. She'S... something has to be done. 
Okay. Thanks, I'm on my way.

Lizzie: A car wash. Oh, right, for your spaulding project! That's a great 
idea, tammy.
Joey: Yeah, tammy. Who washes their car at night?

Tammy: The parking lot is lit up as light as day. I'll get people after 
dinner on their way home.
Joey: Whatever.

Lizzie: I'm sorry, tammy. I really am, okay? I didn't know you were going to 
be here. Otherwise we would have went somewhere else.
Tammy: That's so considerate.
Lizzie: Well, it's the least I can do. I mean, we are...

Tammy: Friends? Is that what you were going to say? You need to stop using 
that word, lizzie, because the last thing we are now is friends.

Buzz: Looks like harley and alexandra are about to duke it out. What 
happened?
Alan: Oh, they're probably talking about frank, that's all.
Buzz: What about frank?

Alan: Well, his behavior tonight at the festivities, buzz, was reason enough 
for discussion, I believe.
Buzz: I think it's a miracle that he held himself together so well.
Alan: Oh, yes. He was a model of self-control, wasn't he?

Buzz: The man was fired, set up to look like he was a dirty cop, not to 
mention the fact that he thinks there's a very good chance that you're the one 
that framed him.
Gus: Excuse us.
Harley: You want me to back off, not her?
Gus: Yes. Yes, you heard me.

Harley: Okay, I understand that alex is a part of your family and I'm trying 
to work with that, but you have to understand that alex...

Gus: This is not about alex, okay? This is about you and me, and, babe, if 
you keep going down this road, I'm afraid there's not going to be a you and me 
anymore. (Laughter)
Joey: Get out of here. Mrs. Lewis, I know what you're going to say to me.
Reva: Oh?
Joey: That I'm a piece of garbage for hurting tammy.

Reva: That may be what you think. Actually, joey, I was going to give you 
some advice because i think you're going to need it. Have you ever heard the 
expression "hell hath no fury like a woman scorned"?

Lizzie: Tammy, you know what? I didn't come here to fight with you tonight, 
all right?

Tammy: Right. Right, you just came here so that I could get an eyeful of you 
and joey together.
Lizzie: That's not true. I didn't even know you were going to be here.

Tammy: (Scoffs) right. You probably had your spies report in where I was 
just so you could accidentally show up with my boyfriend.
Lizzie: Uh, former boyfriend.
Tammy: Only because of you.

Lizzie: You know what, tammy? Go ahead and believe your fantasy that I stole 
joey from you, but you know what? I have news for you. I didn't have to steal 
joey. You lost him all on your own.

Reva: Joey, I can totally relate to a working class kid being given the 
opportunity to peek in on the house of spaulding and being wowed by it, because 
I was that kid. Different house, different time, but I spent a lot of hours of 
my youth wanting in, wanting what those people behind those walls had.

Joey: No, mrs. Lewis, you got it all wrong. I'm not hanging out with lizzie 
because her family's loaded. I like her.
Reva: Well, that's fair. Just be careful.
Joey: Of what?

Reva: Of wanting things that you're not really quite sure you really want to 
begin with.
Joey: I'm cool. Got it handled.
Lizzie: (Groans)
Tammy: Joey and me breaking up was 100% your fault-- no one else'S.

Lizzie: Fine, tammy, go ahead and blame it on me, like everyone else in this 
world. Go! Come on!
Danny: I'm just going a little crazy here.
Rick: What, is this about michelle?

Danny: Yeah, who else? I am so sick of tiptoeing around her and pretending 
that everything is okay.
Rick: Well, what happened? What's going on?

Danny: Rick, it's what happens every day. It's what happened tonight. She 
disappears. She takes off without a word as to where she's going. Maybe if I'm 
lucky later on she'll tell me where she was and what she was doing, but for the 
most part, I have no clue how she spends her time. Before I called you, I got a 
call from that store...
Mel: Egans?
Danny: Egans. About some chair and bar set that she bought.
Rick: Women shop, danny. That's what women do. You're not upset about it?

Danny: She didn't bring the bar set and the chair to the house-- at least not 
our house.
Mel: Well, where are they? Where did she put them?

Danny: Who knows? I have no idea. It's the first I ever heard about it. This 
is what I'm saying, and this is what it's been like: One surprise after another. 
Last night, there was the tattoo.
Rick: Don't tell me she got a tattoo.
Danny: Oh, yes. You know, at least it's relatively tasteful.
Rick: Where is it?

Danny: It's some chinese character that means-- just wait-- "ambition" or 
something, right back here.
Rick: Oh, that's tasteful.

Danny: Yeah. Where the sun basically does not shine-- well, not lately. It'S... 
it'S... really, I can't take much more of this.
Rick: We can't lock her up, can we?

Danny: It's very tempting right now, believe me. Michelle has got to see what 
she's doing.
Mel: How?

Danny: Well, I was hoping that you guys could maybe talk to her. Somebody has 
got to talk to her, somebody who can listen and explain to her that what she 
really needs to be doing right now is spending her time with her family. Someone 
has to explain this to her, someone other than me, because we are obviously not 
on the same wavelength about this.
Rick: You're in luck.
Danny: Why?
Mel: We're expecting my mother any minute now.
Danny: Felicia.

Rick: Mm-hmm. Who can listen and get through to somebody better than a 
therapist? (Dance music qnaying)
Dj: Yo, people.
Here's the lady that's made
springfield a party town again.
Give it up for our hostess this
evening, michelle santos.
Come on. (Dance music playing) (cell phone ringing)
Michelle: Hey, handsome.
Danny: Hey. Well, you're in a good mood.
Michelle: Carpe diem. What's up?

Danny: Well, listen. I ran into rick and mel at towers, and they invited us 
to have dinner with them. So what do you think? Are you up for it?
Michelle: Sure. Why not? I'll be right there. (Music continues)
Danny: Okay, she's on her way.
Rick: I just hope michelle is okay with this.
Mel: I hope mom is okay with this.
Danny: Hey, it'S... it's just dinner with family.
Alan: Why on earth would i want to frame your son?

Buzz: Maybe wanting doesn't have anything to do with it. Maybe you had to, to 
protect yourself or someone close to you.
Alan: That's absurd.

Buzz: Well, I'm not saying i believe it, but it's not out of the question for 
a spaulding to do something like that if the stakes are high. Look at the 
drastic measures you took to hush up maryanne's death.

Alan: You know, and you were with me, buzz, every step of the way. Excuse me, 
but I thought tonight was about the coopers and the spauldings putting all of 
that behind us, coming together. Your daughter, my son is getting married, and 
the better we get along, the better off their future will be, buzz.

Buzz: Not just theirs. You know how I feel about your sister. I want us to 
have a shot at happiness, which is another good reason that the spauldings and 
the coopers should play nice.
Alan: Getting along begins with an act of good faith.

Buzz: I'll tell you what: If you swear that you had nothing to do with 
smearing frank, I'll believe you. I'll do even better than that. I'll offer you 
a deal.
Alan: And what's that?

Buzz: Well, we'll scrap all the history of the families with each other, 
okay? I mean, every sordid bit of it. Start over again fresh.
Alan: You would be willing to do that?
Buzz: For harley, absolutely.
Alexandra: I am going for a little walk.
Gus: Yes, that'S... that's a good idea. So...

Harley: You think this is about my spaulding phobia. You think my suspicion 
of them is what made me go after alex just now.
Gus: Well, it'S... you know, it's there. You can't really deny it.
Harley: Well, I've had good reasons, many of them.

Gus: Yes, babe, you have, and you're really good at dealing with this junk, 
and a million times better than you used to be. I'm just saying that there's a 
wedding coming up, and it's being planned by spauldings, and it's happening at 
the spaulding mansion, and you're marrying a spaulding. And I feel it there, you 
know? Especially when you look at me.
Harley: This isn't about you. You are nothing like those people.
Gus: No, I beg to differ. I am one of those people; I am a spaulding.

Harley: Okay, by blood. But your actions and your heart, I mean, you're a 
whole different species.

Gus: No, I... I... I'm one of them, okay? And really, the bottom line is, if 
you do not trust them, well, then you shouldn't really be trusting me.

Harley: There are some days that you are the only person in the world that I 
do trust.
Gus: Oh, you've got to get out of the house a little more often.

Harley: Honey... (laughs) I'm sorry that you saw me tangle with alex. I 
don't want to worry about your family, and I don't want you to worry about your 
family either. All that matters is you and me, what we have. Everything else, we 
can just tackle...
Gus: I'll do it after the wedding.
Harley: After the wedding.
Gus: Yes.
Harley: Which cannot happen soon enough for me.
Gus: Good. Good. Well, then, there's something that we have to do first.

Lizzie: Joey, we should probably get back to my house and work on the 
project, don't you think?
Joey: Yeah, good idea. Bye, mrs. Lewis.
Reva: Drive carefully.
Lizzie: Oh, he doesn't need to. Bruno is driving us.
Joey: Bruno.
Tammy: Well, in case you were wondering, joey and I are history.
Reva: I kind of picked up on that. And your mother told me.
Tammy: Oh, lizzie spaulding is such a rat!
Reva: You think she took joey away from you?
Tammy: She definitely did. I just... I don't know how.
Reva: You have no idea at all?

Tammy: Well, it's not like i didn't screw up with joey. I did, I admit it. 
But he still had feelings for me.
Reva: How do you know?

Tammy: Joey and I danced together at this party the other night. Okay, well, 
I sort of set the whole thing up, but once it got going, it was so nice, you 
know? Just like it always used to be. The next thing I know, he's kissing lizzie 
and looking at me like I have rabies. I know what you're going to say. I know, 
I'm young, I'll get over it, I'll probably break a few hearts of my own, blah, 
blah, blah.

Reva: Actually, no, that's not what I was going to say. Um... it's valid, but 
that has to be the route you want to take if that's the route you want to take.
Tammy: As opposed to...
Reva: Well, I don't know. Revenge?
Mel: Long day at work?

Felicia: Long and crazy. You should excuse the expression. (Laughter) I'm 
sorry I'm late.
Rick: No problem. Don't worry about it.
Felicia: Well, it's good to see you, danny.
Danny: You, too. You, too. It's been a while.

Felicia: Well, I can finally take off my doctor's hat and put on my family 
hat.
Rick: Um...
Felicia: Is... is something wrong?
Mel: Michelle is going to be joining us later.

Felicia: Well, what does that have to do...? Oh. You had a working dinner in 
mind.

Danny: No, no, no. Please, nothing that formal. We just... we're thinking 
that it might be good for michelle to talk to someone like you.
Felicia: Someone with a degree in psychology?
Danny: A neutral observer...
Rick: Somebody with a degree in psychology.
Felicia: All right, all right.
Danny: ...With a degree in psychology.

Felicia: Danny, I'll be happy to speak with michelle. I think this is a 
positive sign that she's open to discussing the issues facing her. Well, she is 
open to it? Isn't she?
Mel: Hopefully.
Rick: Yeah.

Felicia: Oh, no. If you're planning to set this woman up, the only thing I'll 
say to her is "pass the butter."

Danny: Felicia, I totally get what you're saying, I do. But I'm in a jam 
here, and I do not know what else to do. I really need help in getting through 
to michelle because if i don't, I just... I have a feeling that there'll be 
trouble.
Frank: All right, maynard. One more time, my good man.
Bartender: Sorry, chief. I'm cutting you off.
Frank: Yeah, very funny. Come on, just fill it up.
Bartender: Believe me, I'm doing you a favor. You've had enough.
Frank: You know what? I don't need a favor. I just need a drink.
Gus: Harley cooper, will you marry me?
Harley: I'm having a deja vu. (Laughs)
Gus: Tonight?
Harley: What?

Gus: I thought I wanted, you know, a big wedding and everything, but as it 
turns out, I really only want you. And I don't think I can wait another minute.
Harley: Not even till tomorrow.

Gus: Well, that's the thing. You see, we both have our fathers inside, right? 
And there's plenty of food, and there's actually a judge that i know that owes 
me a favor, so i say we call him up here and get him down here and we do thishim 
down here and we do this thing tonight. Tonight. What do you say?
Tammy: Coming up on "guiding
light":
Danny: Is everything okay?
Michelle: This was all your idea, wasn't it? You set me up!
Harley: Stay away from my father.
Alexandra: Are you asking me to break it off with buzz?
Harley: I'm telling you. Oprah: Singer george michael's
Frank: Maybe you didn't hear me. I said I needed a drink.
Bartender: Hey, man. Come on.
Frank: Do you have a problem? Why can't you get me a drink?

Rick: Excuse me. Excuse me. Frank, what's the problem? Is this guy giving you 
trouble?
Frank: I'll tell you what the problem is. Yeah. He's not getting me a drink!
Rick: Okay, I'll take care of him. Just settle down. Take it easy.
Frank: Well, that was fun. So where's my drink now?

Rick: How about I just get you out of here? Listen, you've got harley's 
wedding tomorrow. Did you forget about that?
Frank: I wish I could.

Rick: Well, let me just do this. Let me take you to company. Your dad's over 
there, right?

Frank: Oh, yeah, yeah. They're all over there. They're all just having fun 
celebrating and everything else.

Rick: Well, good. That's great, frank. You'll fit right in. All right, just 
hang right here. I'll be right back. (Clears throat) guys, frank's had a 
little too much to drink so I'm going to have to take him to company, but I'll 
be right back. I'm sorry about this. Okay?

Danny: Okay. Felicia, I'm really sorry to be putting you on the spot like 
this. Michelle is going to be here any minute.
Felicia: Well...
Danny: But do you think you can help me out with this?
Felicia: Danny, why do you think that her behavior would lead to trouble?
Danny: All I can say is that it already has.

Mel: Mom, danny isn't the only one who's trying to help michelle. The whole 
family could use some guidance.
Felicia: All right. I'll talk to her.
Danny: All right, thank you.
Felicia: But I won't press.
Danny: No.
Michelle: I got here as quick as I could.
Mel: Hey, michelle.
Danny: That was fast.
Michelle: Where's rick?W72

Danny: Yeah, oh, he had to run off for a minute, but he'll be right back. 
So... all right, I'm guessing you don't remember felicia, mel's mother.
Michelle: You're guessing i don't remember?
Danny: You know what I mean. Come on.
Felicia: It's good to see you again, michelle.
Michelle: Thanks.
Felicia: So how are you doing?

Michelle: Aside from total memory loss, perfect. So, felicia, what do you do? 
I mean, everybody in my family seems to be a doctor, so are you a doctor, too?
Reva: What was that saying? "Living well is the best revenge."
Tammy: Has that worked for you?

Reva: I am the walking poster child for it. If I had let all of the 
heartbreak and disappointments get to me, I'd be a really bitter woman right 
now. But instead, I'm signing up for salsa lessons, woo! (Laughs)
Tammy: Okay...

Reva: I'm not saying that dancing lessons are for you, or even that joey is, 
but there's always a way to make yourself a winner, tammy. Always.

Tammy: Well, all I've got going right now is this car wash, and so far 
business sucks.

Reva: Well, you know, that could be because you're in here, and the cars are 
out there.

Tammy: I don't know. I think it's going to take a little bit more than 
manpower to make this operation a winner.
Reva: What about womanpower?
Tammy: What?

Reva: Isn't alan always drilling into you intern wannabes the do's and don'ts 
of success? About using everything possible to make a splash.
Tammy: Splash? For the car wash business? You know, that's good, aunt reva.

Reva: Well, yeah! And it doesn't even just work in your business; it works in 
all business. You have to learn to use your brains and your instincts and 
whatever you have as a woman, in you or on you or around you, to get those dirty 
cars rolling back your way. Think of it that way.
Tammy: Yes! Yes! Womanpower! Aunt reva, you're the best. Thank you!

Beth: Lizzie? I just saw joey in the hall. I thought the two of you were 
working at the beacon tonight.
Lizzie: We were until we ran into tammy.
Beth: Oh. Awkward, was it?

Lizzie: Mom, it was horrible. You know, the thing I don't get most of all is 
that when you look in his eyes, you can see that he hates tammy. But then when 
they're around each other, it's like they just get sucked in.

Beth: Well, maybe he doesn't hate her as much as you think he does. Lizzie, 
if tammy and joey still have feelings for each other, you need to back off.
Lizzie: No way, mom!
Beth: Okay, okay. Where do things stand between you and tammy?
Lizzie: She said we weren't friends anymore.
Beth: Oh, lizzie!

Lizzie: No, you know, that's just the way things go. You know, one minute 
you're best friends and the next...
Beth: Over a guy?

Lizzie: You know, I'm not sorry, though, mom. Joey is an incredible guy, and 
if tammy couldn't keep him interested, that's her problem.

Beth: Well, it could be your problem, too. You don't want to be the rebound 
girl, do you?

Lizzie: I'm not going to be, mom, okay? Joey and I are doing better right now 
than tammy and him ever did.
Beth: Honey, you just said she still gets to him.

Lizzie: Yeah, but it doesn't mean anything. It's just... it's annoying. 
Believe me, joey is over tammy completely.
Beth: (Sighs)
Lizzie: What, now you think I'm in denial?

Beth: No, I'm not saying that. And if tammy and joey have truly broken up, 
and you have feelings for him, you have every right to pursue him.
But...

Lizzie: Good! I am so glad you understand. I knew you would. (Sighs 
contentedly)
Alexandra: Is everything all right?
Buzz: You tell me. You were the one that was going toe-to-toe with harley.

Alexandra: Oh. Well, that was just a little disagreement over seating 
arrangements at the wedding.

Buzz: Well, I can't see my daughter getting so worked up about who sits 
where.

Alexandra: Well, you'd be surprised at how some things become very, very 
important at this time.
Buzz: Yeah. They do, don't they?
Alexandra: What?
Buzz: Certain things have made me think.
Alexandra: Mm.

Buzz: Now, I know you rub each other the wrong way, you and harley, but what 
you've done, planning this wedding, that's special.

Alexandra: Oh, well. You know what this is. It's a major event in this 
family. I could hardly give it short shrift, could I?

Buzz: It's more than that. I mean, frank and I could have thrown a bash. But 
with nadine gone, you know, she misses her mom, and I think that's why you 
offered to lend a hand, and I cannot find the words to tell you how much i 
appreciate that. Especially since the family is all torn up about what frank's 
going through. Oh, forget about the words. Come here!
Alexandra: Oh!
Harley: You're a liar.
Gus: What?

Harley: You don't want to get married tonight for love's sake. This is about 
alexandra.
Gus: (Clears throat)

Harley: Oh, yeah. Because you saw me telling her off and you figured, "you 
know what? If I marry this crazy cooper tonight, I can get her back on track, 
get her focused on my love for her and spare her a day of nerves and tears and 
drama," because you're always thinking of me. And I'm always thinking of you. 
And because of that, we have this huge event planned.
Gus: Mm-hmm.

Harley: Everybody is going to be there. I say let's do it. Let's do it right, 
you know? Let's have the day, and let's remember it for the rest of our lives.
Gus: Okay.
Harley: I want to do it tomorrow.
Gus: Yes, yes. That's the way it's going to be.
Harley: (Laughs)

Gus: All right? That's what we're going to do. That's what we're going to do. 
I love you so much.
Harley: I love you.
Gus: I really do love you.
Harley: I love you.

Frank: I'm serious, rick. It's not just the crap about my job. It's about my 
family. It's about the spauldings. It's about this stinking mess of a wedding. 
Rick, my sister, she deserves to be happy; she truly does. She's such a good 
person, but you know what? She's going to make another mistake, I know it, by 
marrying another spaulding. Are you kidding me? A union of two families, this 
big event? Well, you know what? It's a joke! It's a big joke! It's nothing but a 
pack of lies and fake promises!
Frank: Oh, sis, I'm sorry. I'm sorry.
Harley: That's what you think? That my wedding is a joke?
Frank: No, no, no. I didn't mean it, I didn't mean it, I didn't mean it.
Rick: Harley, you need to give him a break. He's been drinking.
Frank: Sis, come on!

Harley: Gus is a good guy. You know that. He's the only good thing to come 
out of that family.
Frank: I'm sorry.
Harley: Could you take him inside?

Frank: I'm sorry. I really am. Come on!9 I just want her to know... i want 
her to know how much I... how sorry I am, how much I love her! She knows!
Darci: Frank, what's going on here?
Buzz: What did you say to her?
Frank: I didn't mean it. I just... I just want to help her!
Harley: It's okay. I'm just freaking out a little bit.
Frank: (Yelling)
Gus: You just go inside. I'll wait with her.
Harley: Could you go inside, please? I just... please?
Frank: I need to talk to her. I need to make it right.
Darci: Frank, you need to calm down.
Buzz: You've done enough.
Darci: Come on.
Gus: You see what this is doing to harley?
Alan: It's not your fault, gus.
Gus: Really? It's just one of those things? Is that right?

Alan: No, no, no, no. Frank is drunk. He was just shouting off at the mouth, 
that's all.

Gus: It's not like he doesn't know what he's talking about. Lies, lies. It 
feels pretty familiar.
Alan: Now, look, don't do this to yourself, all right? Come on.

Gus: I had every chance to make it right. I just keep it up. I keep the thing 
going. I did it again just now. I did it outside with her just now.
Alan: Okay, enough. Enough, all right?

Gus: It should be enough. You know what I did? I guilt-tripped her just now. 
I said, you know, "I want to marry you tonight," and I made it seem like it was 
out of love, but it wasn't for that. It was because I wanted to distract her 
away from you and alexandra. I'm getting good. I'm getting good. You proud of 
me?
Michelle: So, uh... did we always do this? You know, this q & a thing?
Felicia: Not really. But, hey, who's to say we can't?

Michelle: Who is danny talking to? All right, what's going on, guys? What's 
the matter?
Mel: Nothing.

Felicia: Look, if you ever feel like you really do want to talk, give me a 
call.
Michelle: You're a shrink.
Mel: Michelle...
Michelle: That's why I'm here, right?
Felicia: No.
Michelle: Are you even her mother? Are you?

Felicia: Of course I'm her mother. Look, this was not intended to set you up. 
We were friends. I'm here to help you, michelle.
Danny: What's going on? Is everything okay?
Michelle: This was all your idea, wasn't it? You set me up!
Alexandra: Harley, are you all right?
